column4: a friend of mine has a USB webcam and has installed camorama ... but he gets an error saying /dev/video0 does not exist.... please help...
u need to load the driver (module) for the usb web cam to get the /dev/vide0 to work
how can one tell whether or not the driver for the device is loaded?
im not mch into webcam thing, but u cn see this post. http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=322218..make sure the webcam is supported
pls paste output of lsusb of ur webcam
Bus 001 Device 004: ID 0ac8:307b Z-Star Microelectronics Corp.
u might have a hard time w/ this webcam..can u try sudo modprobe ov51x-jpeg, sudo modprobe videodev
check if u have /dev/vide0 in dmesg
I know that that file does not exist
cant find any support for that webcam in linux
